Set the `COLUMNS` environment variable to an artificially large value for the docker-compose process. This works around newer versions of docker-compose (at least 1.25.0-rc4+) which adjust their output based on the width of the terminal. | https://github.com/palantir/docker-compose-rule/pull/424 |

| Break | `overshadowImplementation` is enabled for all docker-compose-rule builders. Any uses of `ImmutableDockerComposeRule` as returned from `DockerComposeRule.builder()` will now no longer compile. To fix, please use `DockerComposeRule` instead of `ImmutableDockerComposeRule`. | https://github.com/palantir/docker-compose-rule/pull/301 |

name: 0.36.1-rc1
body:
| Type | Description | Link |
| ---- | ----------- | ---- |
| Feature | Events are emitted for pull, build, up, waiting for services and shutdown. | https://github.com/palantir/docker-compose-rule/pull/292 |
- Add shutdown strategy which allows running a callback before shutdown (#271)
- Added network pruning to all shutdown strategies (#256)

* Fixed issue with memoized ports upon (re)start of docker container #237
* Better error message on container failing to listen to a port #229
* Wait for containers to be created before attaching to logs #228
#220: Add method to access `docker-compose config`
* Better errors that tell you why your http checking healthcheck has failed, rather than just that it has failed.

#177: Add support for new YY.MM docker version format. (thanks @samwright!)
#164: Improved logging for Retryer.
#171: Fix regex for splitting on newline characters to work on Windows too. (thanks @samwright!)
#168: Deprecate Aggressive shutdown strategies.
This release fixes a regression in Windows support introduced in v0.31.0 (#166).

name: 0.31.0 — Native docker healthchecks
body:
docker-compose-rule will now wait for containers to become healthy, as specified [in the docker image](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#/healthcheck) or [in the docker-compose config](https://docs.docker.com/compose/compose-file/#/healthcheck), before running tests. This allows users to fold their healthchecks into their Docker container specification, letting the team that releases the Docker image determine what makes their service healthy, rather than having each downstream product reinvent the wheel.

Note that you will need to upgrade to at least docker 1.12.0 and docker-compose 1.10.0 to use native healthchecks.

This release adds new options to:
- pull images on startup
- treat status code 404 as unhealthy

It also adds the following performance improvements:
- Containers are now killed by defaut at test end, rather than stopped, as most images ignore the stop signal, incurring an unnecessary 10 second delay per test. Tests can explicitly specify `ShutdownStrategy.GRACEFUL` if for any reason you still need the old behaviour.
- Docker For Mac users will now be warned if their /etc/hosts configuration looks bad. This issue can affect test performance by an order of magnitude.
Two artifacts will now be published: docker-compose-rule-core and docker-compose-rule-junit4. Depending on the latter should provide the same interface as can currently be used through junit.

name: Split into two separate projects
body: Two artifacts will now be published: docker-compose-rule-core and docker-compose-rule-junit4. Depending on the latter should provide the same interface as can currently be used through junit.

If you're using docker-compose syntax V2, use `ShutdownStrategy.AGGRESSIVE_WITH_NETWORK_CLEANUP` to ensure networks are cleaned up appropriately. Thanks to @ashrayjain for the PR!

(Identical to 0.28.0 due to publish failure)

*Note: As of 0.30.0, we recommend using the default shutdown strategy.*
Fixed #131 "DockerMachine fails if "system" and "additional" environment variables are duplicated", thanks @gsheasby!

- Log collection now uses the more accurate `docker-compose config --services` instead of `docker ps` (thanks to @dev-kpyc!) 
- New `DockerComposeExecOption.noOptions()` helper method.
- All methods on DockerComposeRule.Builder are now 'strict', to avoid accidentally mutating earlier calls when building.

Use  `.saveLogsTo(LogDirectory.circleAwareLogDirectory(MyTest.class))` in your ClassRule builder to ensure that partial logs can be recovered if a CircleCI build is cancelled or times out.  For local runs, logs will just be written to the `$project/build/dockerLogs/MyTest` directory.
new `ShutdownStrategy.AGGRESSIVE` should enable faster build times on CircleCI

- Cleaner gradle warnings thanks to @tomasulo 
- Failed docker operations are now retried after a 5 second delay
- Improved DockerComposeRule builder class

name: Support docker compose kill
body: Thanks to @hsaraogi

name: Docker compose up individual containers
body: Thanks to @d-lorenc for the contribution!

name: Support for docker-compose run
body: @SerialVelocity's PR: https://github.com/palantir/docker-compose-rule/pull/95

name: Deprecate DockerComposition class
body: Intending remove the old `DockerComposition` class soon.  Encouraging people to use `DockerComposeRule` instead.

name: Start/stop containers mid test
body: Thanks to @jkozlowski

name: Don't assume that an SSL exception when health checking a container means it's up
body:
A service can open a port before it's ready to accept SSL connections.

See #81

name: Make default localMachine() choose DockerType based on environment
Add option to remove containers with conflicting names on startup
Remove volumes when deleting containers
body: Remove volumes when deleting containers

name: Fixes an issue with writing container logs after docker-compose 1.7.0
Expose string now return from docker-compose exec.
Return stdout of running docker-compose exec commands
Allow access to host networked ports
docker-compose exec and new API
body: You can now use docker-compose exec to interact with your containers and there is an alternate rule API that will hopefully be more useful going forward.

name: Extra utility methods on SuccessOrFailure
body:
You can now do things like:

`SuccessOrFailure.onResultOf(() -> someMethodThatMightThrowAnException())`

name: DockerPort::inFormat
body:
You can now create string versions of a docker port more easily

`dockerPort.inFormat("http://$HOST:$EXTERNAL_PORT")`

- Adds retry behaviour for `docker-compose up` and `docker-compose ps` to reduce the effect of spurious docker failures. #46.
- Error messages from running `docker-compose` commands now contain the output of that command. #47.
Adds a couple of bugfixes and the ability to define healthchecks for clusters of services.
Add unique project names per DockerComposition.
This changes the wait for services API to be more flexible.

name: v0.4.0
body: Changes the preferred order for choosing a docker-compose executable. `DOCKER_COMPOSE_LOCATION` is not always used if it is a valid file.
